required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Dietary Fiber-enriched Cereals on Glycemic Control and Secretion of Gut Hormones
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Dietary Fiber-enriched Cereals on Glycemic Control and Secretion of Gut Hormones

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to assess whether dietary fiber-enriched cereals effect on postprandial glucose levels and plasma glucagon-like peptide 1 (GLP-1) and/or glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP) concentration in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

detailed_description.textblock: Fifteen subjects with type 2 diabetes mellitus will be provided with study meals based on either dietary fiber-enriched cereals or dietary fiber-poor white bread upon two separate admissions in a cross-over fashion. The study meals will be provided at 6 p.m. and 10 p.m. on the day of admission, and 8 a.m. on the next day. A mixed meal other than the study meals will be given for lunch at noon on the second day. Blood sampling will be done every 30 minutes from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. on the second day. The plasma levels of glucose, GLP-1, GIP, insulin, glucagon, and free fatty acid will be measured.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC) of plasma total GLP-1 levels after intake of the study meal
primary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from 8 a.m. to noon on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma total GIP levels after intake of the study meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from 8 a.m. to noon on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma glucose levels after intake of the study meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from 8 a.m. to noon on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma insulin levels after intake of the study meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from 8 a.m. to noon on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma glucagon levels after intake of the study meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from 8 a.m. to noon on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of serum free fatty acid levels after intake of the study meal
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from 8 a.m. to noon on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma total GIP levels after lunch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from noon to 4 p.m. on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma glucose levels after lunch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from noon to 4 p.m. on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma insulin levels after lunch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from noon to 4 p.m. on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma glucagon levels after lunch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from noon to 4 p.m. on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of serum free fatty acid levels after lunch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from noon to 4 p.m. on the second day

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of plasma total GLP-1 levels after lunch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 30 minutes from noon to 4 p.m. on the second day

arm_group.description: dietary fiber-enriched cereals is provided with 300mL of milk, total 3 times (day 1: 6 p.m. and 10 p.m., day 2: 8 a.m.) amount of cereals: 79g for dinner and breakfast, 38.5g for night snack (10 p.m.) one serving (40g) of steamed egg is added for dinner and breakfast

white bread and strawberry jam is provided with 300mL of milk, total 3 times (day 1: 6 p.m. and 10 p.m., day 2: 8 a.m.) amount of bread: 76g (2 slices) for dinner and breakfast, 38g (1 slice) for night snack (10 p.m.) amount of strawberry jam: 40g for dinner and breakfast, 20g for night snack (10 p.m.) one serving (40g) of steamed egg is added for dinner and breakfast

intervention.description: provided with 300mL of milk, total 3 times (day 1: 6 p.m. and 10 p.m., day 2: 8 a.m.) amount: 79g for dinner and breakfast, 38.5g for night snack (10 p.m.) one serving of steamed egg is added for dinner and breakfast

provided with strawberry jam (20g for night snack, otherwise 40g) and milk (300mL), total 3 times (day 1: 6 p.m. and 10 p.m., day 2: 8 a.m.) amount: 76g (2 slices) for dinner and breakfast, 38g (1 slice) for night snack (10 p.m.) one serving (40g) of steamed egg is added for dinner and breakfast

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- type 2 diabetes mellitus for > 6 months
- HbA1c 6.5~8.4%
- drug-naive or metformin monotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of insulin therapy
- allergy to wheat, flour, other cereals or nuts
- lactose intolerance
- history of hypoglycemic event (plasma glucose level < 70 mg/dL)
- pregnancy / lactation

overall_official.affiliation: Seoul National University College of Medicine
